result.execSummary:
The defendant Devyn A. Brewer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Paid in full from cash bond

Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Devyn A. Brewer in court in custody with attorney Adam Thomas Witt.  Mark Matthew Jahnke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty. Court finds defendant guilty. Defendant waives PSI freely and voluntarily. Court orders 3 years prison and 4 years extended supervision concurrent with 16CF572 and 16CF958. Costs paid in full from bond posted. Stipulation on sentence credit to be filed by 5-25-2018.
